title: Regime-Dependent Breakdown of LCDM Across Cosmic Time
abstract: Multiple observational tensions with LCDM have been reported across disparate redshifts. We present a systematic analysis combining low-redshift galaxy dynamics (SPARC, z ~ 0) with high-redshift galaxy abundances (COSMOS-Web/JWST, z > 6) to test whether deviations from standard predictions cluster in identifiable regimes. Using a descriptive taxonomy (L0-L3), we find that deviations cluster systematically: chi-squared = 47.3, df = 4, p < 10^-8. These results establish structured regime dependence without proposing alternative physics.

positive: Pattern observed independently at low-z and high-z
negative: Does NOT identify unique physical mechanism
